etymology.description: 宀(宀) (mián, "house") + 女(女) (nǚ, "a kneeling woman") = a woman at ease in the house -> peace, safety, calm
etymology.interpretation: The combination of a house and a kneeling woman conveys the sense of tranquility and safety; it symbolizes a harmonious and secure environment.

examples.chinese: 小村庄一直很安(小村莊一直很安)。
examples.english: The small village has always been peaceful.

examples.chinese: 经过风雨洗礼(經過風雨洗禮)，生活变得安(生活變得安)。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò fēngyǔ xǐlǐ, shēnghuó biàn de ān.
examples.english: After enduring storms and rains, life becomes calm.

examples.chinese: 远离喧嚣后(遠離喧囂後)，他找到了内心的安(他找到了內心的安)。
examples.pinyin: Yuǎnlí xuānxiāo hòu, tā zhǎodàole nèixīn de ān.
examples.english: After escaping the hustle and bustle, he found inner peace.
